text: We have a client that bought an email template from the HubSpot Marketplace. It isn't responsive. Is there a way to determine what email templates ARE responsive?
:point_up: this happened to us also, caused major issues for the client

I looked at a few and I didn't see any mention of responsiveness or  mobile tested etc.  Very weird, I remember the process being very rigid when we looked at submission of pages when it first opened.
Surprised this isn't something that is checked for / or maybe this slipped through the cracks?

2.1   Design must display properly at common mobile device and desktop screen widths.

Clarification: Content should take up full width of page without requiring horizontal scrolling, unless horizontal scrolling is the obvious design intent. With hundreds of devices and configurations it is necessary to test each page against as many of them as possible. If you are unable to test against a physical device or desktop screen size then use a software-based approach to test against various configurations.  All templates should comply with HubSpot's 12 column grid system based on Bootstrap 2.x.
So I would imagine that the template maker will have to fix this?

There are obviously some email clients that just aren’t responsive - such as android, gmail mobile, etc.
However, there is an option to ‘make email responsive in the email options.
im pretty sure gmail mobile has responsive capabilities...
<@U22PWJ41G>  I already made sure they had it as "make responsive"
If there are email templates in the marketplace that aren’t meeting responsive requirements please email <mailto:marketplace@HubSpot.com|marketplace@HubSpot.com>
But yes, the template provider should be responsible for updating them.
